title: Wales launches £3.5m fund for circular economy projects
lead: Projects must support the transition towards a zero waste and zero carbon Wales by keeping materials in circulation for as long as possible and avoiding waste

title: On your bike! Thames Water swaps diesel vans for vintage bicycles to cut emissions at Surrey site
lead: The bikes had been found in storage at the site and were refurbished by a local shop – they now cover around five miles each day

title: New York start-ups offered $10m for cleantech solutions
lead: The New York Climate Progress Programme will provide capital investments to support firms that create low carbon goods and services

title: British Embassy in Bucharest seeks projects to tackle climate change
lead: They can focus on renewable energy, restoration of natural habitats and ecosystems and helping communities to prepare for natural disasters

title: Retrofitting homes in northern England ‘could create 77,000 new green jobs’
lead: IPPR North says the move to decarbonise existing housing stock would also generate 111,000 jobs across the UK’s supply chain by 2035

title: SSE, ScottishPower, Natwest Group and National Grid announced as first COP26 sponsors
lead: The government says the Principal Partners will support the delivery of a successful and ambitious COP and notes they represent ‘some of the leading lenders, investors and energy companies in the UK’

title: Elexon to return £1.5m of savings to the industry
lead: The move has been driven by a number of cost efficiencies and savings made by the company, which administers the Balancing and Settlement Code

title: Despite Coronavirus Energy Consultancies shine in new look TELCA
lead: Even in this Covid-19 year, the leading energy consultancies highlight their expertise, mettle and resolve

title: New York announces $11m for fast EV chargers
lead: The Direct Current Fast Charger programme aims to scale up EV infrastructure in areas where access to fast charging stations is limited

title: First UK homes heated with hydrogen in latest demonstration
lead: The ‘HyStreet’ test site consists of specially-built demonstration houses, with more than 200 tests completed to research and prove the safety of converting homes and gas networks to hydrogen
